C0A93F862EF644AC9F8D07F548409685.description: Identify natural phenomena and human activities that cause significant changes in the landscape.

9195FC964B1D466787DB9965D8712DE1.description: Describe effects of wind, water, and ice on the landscape.

6C018B51DAE6439194E91D6FAD336739.description: Use the design process to determine an appropriate system for controlling soil erosion in a given situation

F91B8C5B673C427A9AB80FCCEFEA9CE1.description: Investigate and describe ways in which soil erosion is controlled or minimized in their community and in communities around the world.

5ADE50E44B3D465CB5066AF038D89BD4.description: Investigate and describe ways in which rock contributes to soil formation.

6E1564464DC448F78B0CC76865D06A80.description: Describe how fossils help humans gain a better understanding of Earth's history, including identifying organisms that are now extinct.

5E56466544E9498EBE9D0496AAF2E701.description: Recognize that there are three types of rock, and describe how each is formed.

031AFFB409EE4117BC510C1DDEA1B1CB.description: Describe how characteristics of rocks and properties of minerals determine their uses.

D7A1B74FE8E44916BECB25F613E2618E.description: Give examples of products derived from rocks and minerals.

84B5BC202BE74F4CAFDF868ED6D8CA24.description: Compare rocks and minerals from the local environment with each other and with those from other geological areas.

74596A2722B246C583B364CD423E8321.description: Classify rocks and minerals according to student-generated criteria.

02D8812AE8CA49C58233FD5E8FBCF286.description: Use appropriate vocabulary related to their investigations of rocks, minerals, and erosion.

12D0D1398BE24DA9A5C8A92A07754D81.description: Describe the role of sound in different jobs and hobbies.

EF6DEF0B42624808AC217B9E600B17BA.description: Investigate to identify inventions related to sound, and describe their impacts on society.

636870563FFD42FA8D646F769DBFAE18.description: Describe devices that extend our ability to produce, transmit, and detect sound.

45391FC52BEB44F2988D8E1E5E2216C9.description: Describe how materials that absorb or reflect sound are used in different situations.

DC044A4AF863456793CF8D23C2991A36.description: Explore to determine the ability of materials to transmit or absorb sound.

370F7E113AC248B0828E7F5D2C7EB3C6.description: Investigate to compare how vibrations travel differently through solids, liquids, and gases.

B207ACC6872A41C9BA0AC3B50B1DDE75.description: Describe harmful effects of high or sustained sound levels and identify potential sound hazards at home or in the community.

27A21009BA09455EBE8ED3023FD952DF.description: Describe practices that help ensure protection of the ears and hearing.

E486DDFC283A4F748E92DD55B6AE41DB.description: Recognize that there is a range of sounds that humans can and cannot hear

37FB986F01F84991894C42C6F5A1ABDA.description: Describe how the human ear is designed to detect sound vibrations.

B0C265C625624C1185A1183C61C3C16E.description: Observe and describe properties of sound.

6F1130873F9543188BB97BA2E18EB04C.description: Demonstrate how the pitch and loudness of sounds can be modified.

E6FEC05CE18A4D83B5D55864577D3291.description: Use the design process to create a musical instrument.

145EE2BCDDAB4F5D88F689A34C7C7A05.description: Recognize that sounds are caused by vibrations.

0E84246449AB42A5BA414C4E0B65D038.description: Identify and classify various sounds using student-generated criteria.

1B864B1200734A22A41C946140238CC0.description: Recognize that energy makes things happen and can be found all around us

341AFA72B6684B5A9BE2E484CAC6A890.description: Recognize that sound is a form of energy.

E89080D2307A418099B04403BEF533DC.description: Use appropriate vocabulary related to their investigations of sound.

E785605A37F042ADB878EB890A77BEEA.description: Identify different uses of light at home, at school, and in the community, and explain how the brightness and colour of the light are appropriate for each use.

77FE45E38D4D4F54B4E5D991D9351ABC.description: Describe practices that help ensure protection of eyes and sight.

FADC67D1A84A4831887607DA8FC439C5.description: Use the design process to construct a device that transmits and reflects light.

41683FB5C12B408D8C1806AD4337C7C7.description: Identify technological developments that extend our ability to see, and recognize their impact on science.

40742892F13C48D4B3BE092533F7D55F.description: Predict the location, shape, and size of a shadow based on the position of a light source relative to an object.

6789CD337BB14F889F32D8F10FAFF87B.description: Evaluate the usefulness of a material for a particular task based on its ability to transmit, reflect, or absorb light.

FC3F8ADC32D54803A19453D328C10A7E.description: Classify materials as transparent, translucent, or opaque.

27C36E6725264A0995A17CF08E9B2BF7.description: Recognize that most objects that produce light also give off heat, and identify objects that produce light but give off little or no heat.

EDA497285EF2402BBE2E2579FC1641AA.description: Explore to determine effects different materials and objects have on a light beam.

411AC1FDDA8C4848A935C37A343A48A4.description: Observe and describe properties of light.

B234A7D993AD4069B54C946BFC2CA180.description: Identify a variety of natural and artificial light sources.

DC3A0F047EB242B886EAF97929A50B0C.description: Distinguish between objects that produce their own light and those that reflect light from another source.

D97081F247D547929ABFA203254C471C.description: Demonstrate that white light can be separated into colours.

59BDFC309D434AC5A00FEB423B1DEE6A.description: Recognize that energy is an integral part of daily life.

A1F4460DBC2743BB80C081EA3BD1DE39.description: Give examples of various forms of energy.

BD2745AA9E9A4E3598F70947957B6FB0.description: Use appropriate vocabulary related to their investigations of light.

53375E8DB6AE4339A2C1DB5A2E509240.description: Recognize and appreciate how traditional knowledge contributes to our understanding of plant and animal populations and interactions.

1E30BD3D324742A798E1E84AF42CD18B.description: Describe how specific technological developments have enabled humans to increase their knowledge about plant and animal populations

546B2FB4D58E4B02836A9DBCADACAE99.description: Describe how their actions can help conserve plant and animal populations and their habitats.

C4BB526FD03A421F8FBF6E0941C67AE1.description: Investigate natural and human-caused changes to habitats, and identify resulting effects on plant and animal populations.

A85C299CADCF4B7998EDE19BD6070E9F.description: Predict, based on their investigations, how the removal of a plant or animal population may affect the rest of the community.

70489FF5A0654ACDB49C03AC4F32163B.description: Use the design process to construct a model of a local or regional habitat  and its associated populations of plants and animals

15520BEF5140426DA54ECC2F7D61D91C.description: Construct food chains and food webs, and classify organisms according to their roles.

B061BE32F90440CF92199F63E3F9F605.description: Recognize that the food chain is a system in which some of the energy from the Sun is transferred eventually to animals.

D52BB18FD6524DDB9AD143B9F7826DAF.description: Recognize that plant and animal populations interact within a community.

F6F2C9E04EBE43A08EB0C88CD6AA7216.description: Predict and test to determine an appropriate method for measuring a plant population within a given habitat.

9038BD1B33E74523991CF7F93A81CDAC.description: Investigate and describe a variety of local and regional habitats and their associated populations of plants and animals.

68D607F913E64FFA85B1B11DB0DEC0F7.description: Investigate how technological developments often mirror physical adaptations.

EEA03E4103284B7CB816F1508F469E4B.description: Investigate alternate explanations of plant or animal adaptations based on traditional knowledge from a variety of cultures.

40C6EC6D46EC4C12BC9ADCF655E5884A.description: Identify physical and behavioural adaptations of animals and plants, and infer how these adaptations help them to survive in a specific habitat.

414B8287A31748CE9E64FB432FB2C96C.description: Identify the components of an animal habitat.

13FC2B45F414439D8A301976973756B3.description: Recognize that each plant and animal depends on a specific habitat to meet its needs.

AEE78B81F4BC4D8F8C3288C632F81B49.description: Use appropriate vocabulary related to their investigations of habitats and communities.

1A16AA00489F4765A0E7A7FAB96303CF.description: Report and record what is observed, not what they think they ought to observe, nor what they believe the teacher expects.

4D00CC7197C044408D944E50F52448BB.description: Demonstrate confidence in their ability to do science.

4FC3576AE9294624BCD856AFD229ED17.description: Respect alternative views of the world.

F115C45752E7471F8FC8C7807B7512A7.description: Recognize that designing a solution to a simple problem may have considerations, such as cost, materials, time, and space.

1F208869F6B44F41A90B86362DF43649.description: Recognize that scientists must support their explanations using evidence and scientific knowledge.

0F3324F73B73455190E616098C2962AE.description: Recognize that experimental results may vary slightly when carried out by different persons, or at different times or places; but that if the results of repeated experiments are very different, something must must be wrong with the design of theexperiment.

9F47BE25D4654EE9944425A8B1B25185.description: Communicate results and conclusions in a variety of ways.

392B52D2FEB143C6BADAFF47FAB01E7E.description: Construct meaning in different contexts by connecting new experiences and information to prior experiences and knowledge.

17F1546C16844536973EE4FA05B4F9AC.description: Propose a solution to the initial problem.

C83CB6EB7DD8475ABDE61DD1136D29C8.description: Identify new questions that arise from what was learned.

E5C52E7C3CE54BFB8D44D06082A6C7CB.description: Draw a conclusion based on evidence gathered through research and observation.

C541DF6EA1454C22B5B8A05873687DEA.description: Evaluate, with guidance, the methods used to answer a question or solve a problem.

8F4BBE1F12344156A58DA08C7A2A3179.description: Sort and classify according to an established classification system.

FEDAAC51A6C2475DA0D5BA7003C10094.description: Choose and identify relevant attributes for use in a classification system, and create a chart or diagram that shows the method of classifying.

4FD2C7A8A8174EB8AC260B4FF083227B.description: Identify and suggest explanations for patterns and discrepancies in data.

B7F254A7244140E3ACAE3C875D847C50.description: Construct bar graphs and pictographs using many to one correspondence, and interpret these as well as graphs from other sources.

3A7084CE6F5D4ECBBAF6672A7F7F74D6.description: Record observations in a variety of ways.

00FB9DDB73F84B669A19A27E8A271505.description: Estimate and measure mass/weight, length, volume, area, and temperature using standard units.

7C2698C250784F47B22F877ABACCDA5F.description: Select and use tools to observe, measure, and construct.

F5A115BA6977411291590C150D0B25A5.description: Use tools and apparatus in a manner that ensures personal safety and the safety of others.

19892967725043E7BE3A259959DB7BF5.description: Communicate questions, ideas and intentions, and listen effectively to others during classroom-learning experiences.

1CCDF4B2A3D048228D0324E0CE9711A3.description: Assume roles, and share responsibilities as group members.

E0CC680EEC4847FFA7C4BF160DC92A18.description: Identify problems as they arise, and work with others to find solutions.

89F07F06CA7F487E8E6A30EB22D3BC4C.description: Identify and make improvements to an object, device, or system, and explain the rationale for the changes.

5B23CC1EAD934B35A5FB814458393986.description: Test an object, device, or system with respect to pre-determined criteria.

D9E604C5028B4B71A1B86DF3C4EB70C9.description: Construct an object, device, or system to solve a problem or meet a need.

3D563404693447F69BD6E9BB4D50A550.description: Develop criteria to evaluate an object, device, or system based on its function, aesthetics, and other considerations such as materials, and cost.

9314253F26074FEC9EE83E1CCFB30FCE.description: Create a written plan to solve a problem or meet a need.

02C0BA2D4D2F4A7A91181C36436A56BC.description: Brainstorm possible solutions to a practical problem, and identify and justify which solution to implement.

24467BB4F5784E6B93E2F09B75CAE833.description: Create, in small groups, a plan to answer a given question.

B12C6246B86A4B77930C8B77AB2D4DBD.description: Identify, in small groups, variables that have an impact on an investigation.

6B52B62DB2C345EFABED1243F9D52D77.description: Brainstorm, in small groups, one or more methods of finding the answer to a given question, and reach consensus on which method to implement.

43D52BCA2070480FBFA9F868F7849943.description: Review information to determine its usefulness to inquiry or research needs.

DC5953FB96C947EABE759CE41858A8E7.description: Access information using a variety of sources

641589BAAEB543FDA773390BA5ED4A18.description: Identify practical problems to solve in the local environment.

802BAE90DFBD4C3C80D05EEE534CE0BA.description: Make and justify predictions based on observed patterns, collected data, or data provided from other sources.

F22B78C6A4B7413C9C8EBBD498EACE5D.description: Ask questions that lead to investigations of living things, objects, and events in the local environment.
